P113468.project_name: Guinea Bissau--Food Price Crisis Response Program

keywords.cdata: agricultural inputs, agricultural season, Agriculture, audit reports, cropping, extension, farmers, fertilizers, financial management, food for work, Food Price, Food Production, Food Security, Food-for-work, GA, growing season, Habitats, intervention, meal, micro-projects, paddy, pesticides, Pests, planting, Regional Vice President, Resettlement, rice, rice production, Rural Development, safeguard policies, Safeguards, seeds, smallholder farmers, WFP, World Food Program

project_abstract.cdata: This paper reports on the development objective of the Food Price Crisis Response Trust Fund Program Project for Guinea Bissau, which is to improve food security for the most vulnerable population, including children, and increase smallholder rice production in project areas. The project will be part of said assessment, and when resumption of communication is determined, the team will seek formal validation of the extension and preparation of the action plan. Guinea-Bissau is a fragile country, and the international community has already warned about aggravation of the food crisis in light of the coup. Once the assessment is complete, a rapid re-engagement of project implementation will contribute to alleviate the problem. The project's objectives are still achievable, and there are key implementation actions to be completed. Supervision is still ongoing to the extent possible. Due to the fact that the Bank is still assessing the situation and has not resumed communications with the government, there is currently no request from government to extend the project. The extension is motivated due to the extraordinary circumstances in the country, and as a precautionary measure, in order to give time to the Bank to assess the situation. The project development objectives are still achievable and, as indicated, there is still money to be disbursed to complete the procurement and payment of critical goods.

P113468.projectinfo: <![CDATA[<Project><LangCode>FR</LangCode><ProjectName>Guinée-Bissau : Programme d’intervention en réponse à la crise des denrées alimentaires, Financement supplémentaire</ProjectName><ProjectAbstract>Le Projet d’urgence à l’appui de la sécurité alimentaire (EFSSP) doit contribuer au financement des activités à court et moyen terme visant à atténuer l’incidence de l’augmentation des prix des denrées alimentaires en Guinée Bissau, compte tenu de l’évolution de ces prix à l’échelle mondiale. Ce projet doit aider le Gouvernement de la Guinée Bissau à réagir à la crise alimentaire et comprendre les trois composantes suivantes : i) l’appui à une amélioration de la sécurité alimentaire de la population la plus vulnérable à travers les programmes d’alimentation scolaire et de travail rétribué en vivres ; ii) l’appui au plan national d’urgence de la campagne agricole 2008-2010, proposé par le ministère de l’Agriculture et du Développement rural, en vue de l’accroissement de la production alimentaire et de la productivité, avec un accent particulier sur le riz ; et iii) la coordination, le suivi et l’évaluation du projet. On s’attend à ce que le projet s’achève après une période de trois ans.</ProjectAbstract></Project>]]>
